website_summaries.verdict: Top-notch craftsmanship paired with premium construction materials promise even heat distribution and superior durability, use after use.
pros: Robust carbon-steel construction heats evenly for consistent results
Non-stick coating works beautifully for easy release and hassle-free cleaning
Generous 4-inch diameter makes bigger muffin tops and works well for buns too
cons: Non-stick coating wears down faster in a dishwasher

customer_reviews.title: Great sandwich bread shape
customer_reviews.text: We use this pan for keto friendly breads and it’s been a huge help. It creates the perfect shape. Non stick and super easy to clean. Really glad we tried this out.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Emily

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for ketoers!
customer_reviews.text: LCHF Keto dieter here. This pan is amazing, it's highly rated in the keto community and has been a great tool for me in the kitchen! You can use it for eggs, cookies, keto bread replacements, crusts, the list goes on. Nothing sticks to it, it doesn't even appear dirty/greasy after I remove the food. No need to scrub. Definitely recommend and would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great pan and GREAT customer service
customer_reviews.text: Great product, great customer service. I make omelet muffins in these. I thought the holes were too big, but my omelets muffins (flourless) come out like delicious, crusty popovers. I do coat the pan with either butter or a little bit of coconut oil. If you have any issues: call Chicago Metallic customer service... they are great! I had a sticking problem with a muffin top pan (all my others from them work fine.) I had a new pan from them in a matter of days. No return shipment of the old pan, no questions asked... I had photos. They didn't want them. They are a pleasure to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: BarbZ

customer_reviews.title: We love pancakes!  If you do too, try this pan!
customer_reviews.text: What a time saver - I won't make pancakes on a griddle again!! I love, love these pans (I bought 3). I use these for pancakes, how nice that everyone's pancakes are all done at the same time. Some I top with blueberries, some with chocolate chips, some with cooked sausage. I didn't use any cooking spray or shortening, and they popped out of the pans easily. I am used to using good quality pans (All-Clad, Anolon) and I give these pans high marks for quality. Thank you Chicago Metallic!!
customer_reviews.author: April - Central Iowa

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this once. I really wanted to like this but it just didn't turn out great. My son will eat the tops of muffins only and leave the rest so I thought this might be a good solution. The holes are really big so you need a lot of batter. So I did more muffin tops with less batter in each and they turned out more of a cookie shape so my son wasn't really thrilled with it. It's a great pan if you really want to make muffin tops, but you probably need to completely fill it which takes a lot of batter.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Not really non-stick but works
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pan in March 2020. I have used it every weekend since to make pancakes. At first, the pancakes slid right off the pan. Over time, however, the surface has become less non-stick. I now have to use a fork to remove the pancakes. I also recently started using the pan to make potato pancakes. I follow the manufacturer's cleaning instructions. Full disclosure: I spray Pam before baking and bake the regular pancakes at 425 degrees (F) and bake the potato pancakes 450 degrees. The pan works, but do know that in a few months it most likely will not be as non-stick (but still usable).
customer_reviews.author: Ann Solan

customer_reviews.title: Best oopsie roll pan!
customer_reviews.text: For low-carb oopsie rolls (also known as cloud bread) these are the best! I do give them a spritz with some non-stick spray for extra reinforcement, but the non-stick coating is nice. The buns come out perfectly shaped, very similar to the bottom of a hamburger bun. I like this pan so much that I ordered another one so I can make a double batch of my bread at once. A quick swish with a dish brush gets off any little crumbs, then I either just hand-wash or put them in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa W.

customer_reviews.title: Large Whoopie Pies
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these pans because I wanted the larger size whoopie pie that the Wilton pan doesn't offer. The size was just what I wanted, they baked well and were easy to remove from pan. My only complaint would be that the pan is so thin and flat, that it was tricky getting a grip on it to take out of the hot oven. Otherwise, it's a nice addition to my bakeware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: And this weeks star baker is...
customer_reviews.text: Made first two batches of Yorkshire pudding and came out legit! I mean, Paul Hollywood would probably stare me down with those icy blue eyes and say something I couldn’t understand due to his accent , but my wife loved them. Very easy to clean, you get the rise out of them (and not that cupcake tin rise BS, a proper wide puddin rise) Worth the calories.
customer_reviews.author: N Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Dark pan
customer_reviews.text: There are 2 rules in baking. Rule 1 is do not use dark colored bake ware. Rule 2 is to see rule 1. I'm glad I didn't spend a lot of money on this pan because it's going to go in the trash bin. Nothing against Chicago Metallic as I have other light colored pans from them and they are just fine and I've had them for a long time and use them a lot. I should have known better than to buy a dark colored baking type pan.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Sticks!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this muffin pan was nonstick. I put eggs in it to make sandwiches and it stuck terribly. I even added oil to it. I was so disappointed that I returned it. I can only image what it would do to cale batter.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Grease pan or it sticks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pan to cook eggs for breakfast sandwiches. Pro: It make a perfectly size egg for an english muffin or a tiny waffle from my Dash waffle maker. Others complained their pan was bent, mine wasn't. Con: Grease it a little or the eggs will stick and the leftover egg doesn't just wipe out. Even a spritz of Pam will help. I haven't made muffin tops, but I'm sure the same caveat will apply.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Works, but Eggs Stick A Little
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make egg white patties for breakfast sandwiches. I spray it with cooking spray before pouring in egg whites, and I use a rubber spatula to remove the patties. That mostly works, but the eggs do stick, and it's hard to scrub off - at last with a scrubber sponge. (I haven't tried anything more abrasive.)
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good -- hand wash only
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like this pan. I use it to make flat egg patties for egg sandwiches. Two drawbacks: * It's supposedly dishwasher safe, but mine most not be watertight or something, because it leaks rusty water all over the dishwasher. It seems fine when I hand wash it. * Because it's so shallow, it's very easy to spill, especially as you're putting it into the oven. I'm not sure how that problem would be fixed, but it is a bit aggravating.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer15

customer_reviews.title: Great for Yorkshire pudding
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try making a friend's Yorkshire pudding recipe but did not have a proper pan. This one looked similar to the one my friend uses, so I decided to give it a try. The puddings baked up beautifully! The pan is easily cleaned as the nonstick coating works well. I have only used it twice, so I can't remark on it's durability yet, but it appears well made.
customer_reviews.author: Tucker's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Surprising quality !
customer_reviews.text: No dislikes at all ! I have used this for mini fritatats ( omlets to us less informed snobs ) and cloud bread. Am very pleased with quality of pan. Can't speak of durability as of yet but expect it to be right up there at the top. Have cast iron for my muffin tops but would expect this to be fine in that also .BUY, you won't be disappointed !
customer_reviews.author: Roger simmons

customer_reviews.title: I like this product and purchased it due to being on ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this product and purchased it due to being on keto diet. There was a recipe on line that required using this pan for making a keto bread for sandwiches on it. Sturdy, arrived on time and without any scratches.
customer_reviews.author: BECA G

customer_reviews.title: Great for making egg patties for breakfast sandwiches
customer_reviews.text: These work perfectly for making egg patties for breakfast sandwiches. I have not liked using regular muffin tins in the past because I felt that the egg patties were too thick for a sandwich. This nicely makes an egg patty that fits on a bagel perfectly. Also fits english muffins with a little overhang but I don’t mind that.
customer_reviews.author: Cat L

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Corn Toaster Cakes
customer_reviews.text: Who knew that there was a Muffin Top pan? I didn't until I Googled a recipe for Corn Toaster Cakes and this type of pan was recommended. This pan delivered perfectly cooked toaster cakes! If you're from New England,have eaten Thomas' corn toaster cakes and would like to make them yourself, this sturdily constructed pan with a non-stick surface (still recommend using oil to ensure baked good removes from pan easily does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make Keto "bread". I had a small waffle maker it worked great, except I was making one bun at a time. I meal prep so making a weeks worth took quite awhile. Bought this and it was a game changer! I love it! Works great and sure is faster than my old way of doing things.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: Muffin Top and so much More!
customer_reviews.text: These pans are wonderful. Non-stick - YES. Even larger than I thought. I used these to make noni bread for burger bun replacements - great! I made high fat low carb pound cake in these to create perfect layers for my strawberry shortcake - Again, perfect! I wish I didn't wait to order these. Solid pan, edges are evenly pressed, no rough edges. Overall, a very reliable pan that cooks evenly and as advertised, does not stick.
customer_reviews.author: BaggyB

customer_reviews.title: Best muffin tin EVER
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best piece of bakeware I've ever owned. I needed something specifically non-stick as I use this primarily to make individual servings egg cups for breakfast, and all other muffin tins took days to clean. I'm talking, scraping your nail around the whole thing to get all the pieces of egg off. After I use this you can hardly tell it's dirty because there is nothing left behind. I don't know how this will work for baked goods, but I imagine it will perform wonderfully. I want to eventually exchange out all my bakeware for Chicago Metallic. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Farahani

customer_reviews.title: Chicago Metallic Non-Stick original muffin top
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these pans- one for myself and 1 as a gift- with the intention of making my own hamburger buns. I haven't yet done that but I've used it several times to make muffin tops and those come out great in this pan. Even though it's nonstick I still spray them first, the tops bake well and then the pan is a breeze to clean. There is ample space to grab the pan out of the oven and it doesn't take a lot of space to store because it's not deep like a regular muffin pan.This was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Terrific pan for jumbo muffins
customer_reviews.text: Terrific pan for jumbo muffins, jumbo cupcakes, mini cakes, baby cakes etc. Quality weighted feel & smooth non-stick surface. Ordered a second one because I liked the first one - which I've had for YEARS - so much. I like all the Chicago Metallic bakeware I own. Whenever I think about adding a piece of metal bakeware to my kitchen, I look at CM products & usually end up buying them. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AlmostJane

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for cooking eggs ahead of time!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pan specifically for cooking egg white patties for breakfast sandwiches. As another reviewer said, this pan is the perfect size for that! Don't freak like I did when you notice the pans are slightly bigger than your English muffin--your egg/egg white will shrink a little. I did 3 tbsps of carton egg whites in each cup, on 350• for approximately 13 minutes (I just watched until they looked solid). I'm so excited to be able to prepare breakfast sandwiches ahead of time! (Not to mention saving about 100 calories compared to an Egg McMuffin!!)
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Both were dented in the edge but due to virus I am stuck with them
customer_reviews.text: I am giving these only 3 stars because even though I really needed these so I was unable to return them they were both damaged! That is pathetic that during a time when people are desperate and can't be discerning about quality that I have to be stuck with damaged goods. Pathetic no matter HOW good the product actually is.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C. Meeder

customer_reviews.title: My new favotite kitchen “gadget”
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make gluten-free muffins and breakfast eggs. This shape tin makes the exact size eggs for the muffins (or any standard-size muffins or hamburger buns). You can get really creative with say hash browns, pancakes, etc. Heavenly! Also very quick and easy to wash by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Georgianna Laws

customer_reviews.title: Am happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for our intended purpose (which was to make homemade gluten free burger buns). Am happy with the purchase. Next, I want to try spraying the pan very lightly with olive oil, cracking eggs into the pans and try baking them.... We shall see how that goes....
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I use this everyday to make breakfast sandwiches. I use large eggs and bake in the oven for 7 mins at 350. I have tried the whoopie pie pans and they just didn't hold up for everyday use and were hard to clean. even though they were non-stick as well. So happy to have found these muffin top pans. Wish I could find them in a 12 size.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: More than Muffins
customer_reviews.text: This pan is the perfect size to bake eggs for breakfast sandwiches on English muffins! One egg fits perfectly in each circle along with room for some veggies. The Non-stick allows easy removal and clean up. Its a great way to premake healthy breakfast for the week!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Muffin top pan
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw this item in a store I didn't think much about buying it. But when I switched to a low cab eating plan, I had to have this pan! You can make burger sized rolls that can be split in half...a great little convenience. You can also make hand pies and cakes for the kids. The pan is coated with Teflon, is about an inch deep and makes great muffin tops or bread rolls that are perfect for sandwiches. The pan is very easy to keep clean and to store. I now have three of these and use them at least once a week!
customer_reviews.author: Mary S. Long

customer_reviews.title: So Far This Muffin Pan Works
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this pan twice since I bought it, so I cannot speak to its durability or if it will twist while in the oven at some point. Right now though, it cooks evenly and is very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: SSG

customer_reviews.title: Great for eggs 6 at a time.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I got this to bake eggs in for pre made egg sandwiches. Each well holds one egg with other ingredients perfectly. (I just did 1 egg plus cheese, or scrambled eggs plus onion and peppers). Came out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Vittoria duSolie

customer_reviews.title: Great pan! Perfect non-stick!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pan! I use it to bake eggs into the perfect shape for breakfast sandwiches. I crack an egg into a little bowl, scramble it, and pour it into the mould (with a little cooking spray on there). I bake them in the oven, flip them once, and viola! I have 6 eggs for sandwiches all at once!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Van Arsdel

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Well, I got these because my kids love my muffins but for whatever crazy reason they eat the top and not the bulk of the muffin and I was DONE throwing muffin bottoms away. Sounds funny but it's true...I used them and they love, love, love the muffin tops. From my baking perspective it takes longer because I can only make 12 at a time (I bought 2) but it's worth it. Since I've only had for a little while...I'll say they seem high quality but who knows. After I use for a few more months I'll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Laurag

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pan for muffin tops.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this pan to replace a pan I had used for 30 years. This pan is a nice weight. It's non-stick but I still grease it just to make sure the muffins don't stick.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Gluten-Free English Muffins.
customer_reviews.text: The gluten-free English muffin recipe I use makes an extremely sticky dough, but with the help of these Chicago Metallic Non-Stick Muffin Top Pans, the muffins bake up beautifully and slide off without any need for cooking spray. They come out more rounded on top than traditional English muffins, but that isn't a problem for me. I use the muffins in a dedicated Hamilton Beach breakfast sandwich maker. YUM!
customer_reviews.author: sparqle

customer_reviews.title: Bun Maker
customer_reviews.text: The non-stick Muffin Pan is perfect for making your own buns for hamburgers, sandwiches and etc. I was thrilled to find one and bought another for daughter.
customer_reviews.author: August

customer_reviews.title: They're Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for making sandwich buns as well as big cookies. I don't make muffin tops but I'm sure it's great for those. They are really non-stick and clean up quick and are very lightweight. My daughter saw them and her eyes popped out so I got them for her and the New England Hot Dog pan. Haven't gotten her review on that yet. I really love my Chicago Metallic Professional Non-Stick Muffin top pans!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, useful pan!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great pan. Good quality, can make perfect eggs or egg whites for sandwiches, muffin tops, brownies, etc. I use it frequently, it’s easy to clean and will be part of my kitchn for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Brenna

customer_reviews.title: These are great! I use them to make English Muffin sandwiches ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I use them to make English Muffin sandwiches for the freezer. I cook the eggs in it. I do spray them a little but and they slide right out. I have also made browines in them. Easy to clean and don't seem like they will easily warp.
customer_reviews.author: rlb

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Super excited about this pan...I have purchase from the same company before and love, love, love this product can't wait to use this weekend 😁
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Fe

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but low quality
customer_reviews.text: The coating started coming off as soon I started using it. I’ve had it for a month, and used it heavily to make eggs. I can’t use it anymore. I used cooking spray and the eggs still stick. I literally can't get the egg off of the pan without scratching the pan. I tried contacting the manufacture and have heard nothing back from them. This pan is not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Weaver

customer_reviews.title: usage
customer_reviews.text: it looks jumbo when delivered and taken out of the box, so you can't really use it in a toaster oven because it won't fit inside.
customer_reviews.author: General Warthog

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for muffin-tops...
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace well-used muffintop pans. Worked perfectly. Bought 2 more. Great for making muffins that are thin and not cakey. Top with crumb mixture and bake for 13-15 minutes for the BEST muffins ever! In our opinion...
customer_reviews.author: JanLayMay

customer_reviews.title: Great for Gluten Free hamburger buns
customer_reviews.text: I use non-stick spray, my gluten free bread recipe and out slides beautiful hamburger buns just the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Sunde

customer_reviews.title: Great pan to cook gluten free or regular breads
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this pan. This was recommended by GourmetGirlCooks.com as a great way to bake gluten free bread, and I must say, she's correct. This pan allows me to cook individual sized gluten free bread and it comes out moist and perfect each time. Since I'm not gluten intolerant, I also baked hamburger buns and english muffins for my family in this pan. Everything came out perfectly cooked.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: This is the best available anywhere
customer_reviews.text: This makes muffin tops a breast. The pan cleans so easily, it is a joy to use. It has quality throughout. I will give a heads up, The muffin pan does get stained.
customer_reviews.author: Mary quinlan

customer_reviews.title: Great for making hamburger buns
customer_reviews.text: I never made hamburger buns before and wanted to give it a try. This pan helped make my first try turn out great! I was so impressed with myself, but I know the pan had something to do with it. The shape is the perfect size for burger buns; easy to use and clean plus it seems sturdy and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jharfer

customer_reviews.title: Great pan with many uses.
customer_reviews.text: This little pan is lightweight but a very good cooker. It cooks biscuits, eggs can be baked in each holder. It's great. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Segura

customer_reviews.title: One cup was smashed
customer_reviews.text: Arrived damaged. My wife open it until a month after Christmas and noticed one of the cups was damaged. Used a mallet to shape it back.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Great for egg patties
customer_reviews.text: I love this pan. I use it to make egg patties for my Homemade egg McMuffins.
customer_reviews.author: jed

customer_reviews.title: Great for Chaffles!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for making Keto buns referred to as Chaffles. Comes right out of the pan...very nonstick!
customer_reviews.author: linda marie cope

customer_reviews.title: Tops of bun size terrific!
customer_reviews.text: Making homemade gluten free and grain free buns are what I used this for...works well.
customer_reviews.author: Mommabear

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and my baked goods came out perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Great for making Keto bagels! Nice durable pan, everything slid off easily after taking baked goods out of the oven.
customer_reviews.author: Karen J. Robati

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Sloped sides and one piece make it easier to clean than our perpendicular multipiece more expensive one.
customer_reviews.author: KAR

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for baking eggs too!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I use this to make home made breakfast sandwiches that I freeze, this keeps me away from mcdonalds. Just scramble six eggs and distribute evenly into the pan after spraying with cooking spray like Pam. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or so and you are good to go. Add an english muffin, cheese, meat if you want it, and freeze. Love it. Saves money, less sodium than fast food, and tastes better.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looked everywhere for muffin to pans and finally found these. Lost mine after renting home for years and have looked to replace the ones I had. These pans are great and making muffin tops makes the best part of the muffin come home again! LOVE THESE!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia H

customer_reviews.title: For Buns and Egg rounds: buy this
customer_reviews.text: This pan produced excellent results when making almond flour buns and egg rounds for breakfast sandwiches. I've been on a ketogenic diet for ~80 days and this pan is invaluable for making buns and low carb bread replacements. The size of the finished products are smaller than "premium" store bought buns and are closer to the cheapest hamburger bun you can buy cut in half. That isn't an issue though, as this makes low carb bread replacements much easier to make. Only wish I'd bought two pans to save time on large batches.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Seuser

customer_reviews.title: Great nonstick pan!
customer_reviews.text: This is a truly nonstick pan. I have already used it more than a dozen times, anad have not needed to oil or grease it for any of several recipes. Cooled muffins lift right out, leaving nothing at all behind. It wipes clean. This pan makes great low-carb sandwich rounds using flaxseed meal, as well as terrific muffins made with coconut or almond flour. I can't vouch for wheat flour, becasue I don't use it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size, but Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I haven't cooked with this yet, but I noticed immediately after opening that the metal is very thing and the pan was slightly bent - I bent it back into shape, but can see this becoming a problem when storing.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Moore-Ward

customer_reviews.title: Easy to remove alloy
customer_reviews.text: We use to mold liquid metal into reusable blocks. Easy to remove the alloy and creates a muffin that doesn’t weigh too much to handle.
customer_reviews.author: cbohler

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Makes the best muffin tops. Very easy to clean. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Susan A Creed

customer_reviews.title: McDonalds has nothing on me now!
customer_reviews.text: While this pan is advertised for use as a muffin top pan, I bought it for making eggs in the oven for breakfast sandwiches. The resulting egg size is perfect for use on english muffins or bagles. A whole pan will make 6 eggs at a time, I do recommend using a non-stick spray just to make life even easier. In case you are wondering: 6-7 minutes at 350 degrees should do it!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy H. Hessler

customer_reviews.title: The individual depth of each muffin opening is pretty shallow. i found one at Bed Bath and ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this pan to make those "on the go" egg sandwiches. The individual depth of each muffin opening is pretty shallow. i found one at Bed Bath and Beyond that worked much better and was $5 cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy 1....BUY 2!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this pan! I use it to make egg sandwiches, pancakes, little pizzas and much much more. Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Nix

customer_reviews.title: Buy Them!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these pans! I made little mini pizzas the other day and they slid right off the pan! These also make the perfect bread buns and are extremely easy to wash. I bought two of these and they have been fantastic every time I've used them! HIGHLY recommended!
customer_reviews.author: J Z

customer_reviews.title: Muffin, muffin, where is the muffin?
customer_reviews.text: Shopped around until I found the latest and greatest invention. Muffin top pans. Several low carb recipes use this pan for baking and keeping us legal. I have used mine several times and love love love them. Yes, I bout the one that makes 12 muffins. The creativity of the chef inside us comes out when you think of all the possible uses for these two items. Gotta have em in your baking supplies. jaqui
customer_reviews.author: Jaqui Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Individual portions of yumminess!
customer_reviews.text: So much better than a muffin pan. . . and easier than making a loaf of banana, blueberry, or pumpkin bread and slicing it up for the week! Everyone gets the crisp edge piece :) Going to try brownies in here next.
customer_reviews.author: Amy E.

customer_reviews.title: ... make a bunch of Egg McMuffin sandwiches - worked great. Sprayed it with vegetable oil
customer_reviews.text: Just used this today to make a bunch of Egg McMuffin sandwiches - worked great. Sprayed it with vegetable oil, dropped an egg into each one, baked for 10 minutes at 350, and the finished eggs just SLID out! Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Same amount as a regular cupcake pan
customer_reviews.text: Even though the pan is shallower than a normal cupcake pan it still using the same volume of batter. Just give you more yummy, crusty muffin top.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cargill

customer_reviews.title: Cheese Muffins
customer_reviews.text: I use this pan to make cheese muffin tops to use for burger buns on the keto diet. It's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: mfern87

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Oopsie Rolls.
customer_reviews.text: I make a low carb bread called Oopsie Rolls. I used to just pour out the batter on parchment paper. Now I make them in the muffin top pan and they always come out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: DaDued

customer_reviews.title: Would not suggest this baking pan
customer_reviews.text: Most horrible baking pan I’ve ever had. I make homemade muffins weekly, and never had a pan like these. They burn the product easily no matter what temp I’m at.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette F

customer_reviews.title: Versatile product
customer_reviews.text: This pan is great for making almond buns, a keto- friendly non gluten bread. I use my pans every week to make these and have given pans also to family members. I also make moon pies with this pan.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect muffin tops
customer_reviews.text: I've used it and I'm buying more. Great quality and the muffin tops brown very nicely.

customer_reviews.title: Food Does Not Stick
customer_reviews.text: The non-stick products from Chicago Metallic have always produced the results I've expected. The finished product never sticks and the pan is easy to clean. I have never been disappointed with any of the Chicago Metallic non-stick products.

customer_reviews.title: The perfect pan
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for the perfect pan to cook big cookies, muffin tops, egglets (eggs for breakfast sandwiches), and whatever else your imagination comes up with, this is the pan for you. Everything comes out perfectly, doesn't stick, and cleans easily. Bravo!

customer_reviews.title: Bake perfectly sized eggs for breakfast sandwiches!
customer_reviews.text: Not just for muffins! I was looking for an easy way to prep egg sandwiches for the week. bake in lightly greased (try a tiny bit of olive oil) pan and even add spinach leaves at the bottom of each section before cracking the egg into the sections. Pop all the cooked eggs into a ziplock and so fast to reheat during the week.

customer_reviews.text: I use for making egg sandwiches for breakfast. I make enough for week and microwave in AM. This works great for this purpose!

I needed a second because I wanted to make a dozen giant muffins at a time. I couldn't find a decent giant muffin pan around my way and I don't live in the sticks.

customer_reviews.text: these pans are awesome! should still use non-stick and the getting the right amount of batter to not overflow takes a little adjustment but the end result is a hit with my family.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived scratched, but otherwise a great pan.
customer_reviews.text: The pan arrived scratched in one muffin top opening and slightly dented in another, which was disappointing. Other than that, I like the pan and have used it for muffin tops, egg mcmuffins, and mini cauliflower crust pizza. Easy to clean.

product_meta.title: Chicago Metallic Professional Non-Stick Muffin Top Pan, 15.75-Inch-by-11-Inch, Grey, Standard -
product_meta.description: Style Name:6-Cup Muffin Top PanCut out the stumps. Only muffin tops here. This original creation is one of a kind for all the muffin lovers out there. This pan is also ideal for making large, perfectly shaped cookies. Its non stick, easy release construction features the same attention to detail that made Chicago Metallic the preferred choice by bakers who understand quality, design and durability. Oven safe to 450°f/ 232°c; not intended to be used under the broiler. Sharp edged utensils and knives should not be used. at Chicago Metallic, we believe that serious baking requires serious bakeware. That’s why we’ve been crafting innovative equipment, for professionals and serious home bakers, for over 100 years. We’ve built a global reputation one kitchen at a time. People know our products are built for durability and can be depended on year after year. We’re proud to offer three distinct lines of premium bakeware plus stylish, innovative specialty bakeware and baking essentials. The Chicago Metallic professional line of bakeware makes cooking and baking a delight. The non stick surface easily releases each recipe and makes clean up effortless. It’s the preferred choice of bakers who understand quality and design, but also want professional grade durability.
feature_bullets: PREMIUM QUALITY, DURABLE AND LONG LASTING: The Chicago Metallic Non Stick Muffin Top Pan is crafted from heavy weight carbon steel for superior heat conduction and even baking
NON STICK COATING FOR EASY RELEASE: The Chicago Metallic Non Stick Muffin Top Pan features a non stick surface. The non stick coating calls for an exceptional baked good release and easy clean up

THE PERFECT SIZED MUFFIN PAN: This non stick muffin top pan is the ideal size for all of your baking needs. The non stick pan measures 15.75 inches x 11 inches and bakes up to 6 muffin tops. Each cup measures 4 inches x 0.5 inches
DISHWASHER SAFE FOR FAST CLEAN UP: This muffin top pan is dishwasher safe, making clean up fast and easy however hand washing is recommended to extend the product life

BAKE THE PERFECT MUFFIN TOPS: This non stick muffin top pan has a shallow cup design that creates delicious muffin tops; each muffin well is 0.5 inches deep. This pan also bakes perfectly sized eggs, cookies for ice cream sandwiches, and small layer cakes

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,327 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
